get.description:
Access the root endpoint of the billing API to discover available billing resources

**Authentication:** This endpoint supports API User authentication.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: meshApi is versioned and you should use  `application/vnd.meshcloud.api.v1.hal+json` as an `Accept` header to be guaranteed the V1 response format of this endpoint. New versions will be added in future.

get.description:
Access the root endpoint of the billing meshObjects API to discover available billing mesh object types

**Authentication:** This endpoint supports API User authentication.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: meshApi is versioned and you should use  `application/vnd.meshcloud.api.meshobjects.v1.hal+json` as an `Accept` header to be guaranteed the V1 response format of this endpoint. New versions will be added in future.

get.description:
List all meshChargebacks with optional filtering by workspace, project, and billing period.
**Note**: If no request parameters for filtering are specified, all meshChargebacks are returned
independently of these parameters. By default, meshChargebacks are sorted descending by period.

**Info**: The meshTenantUsageReport endpoints are the preferred endpoints to get cost data from
meshStack. The meshTenantUsageReport endpoints provide more detailed information and more filter
options than the chargeback statements. They contain basically the same information as a chargeback,
but only per tenant, not per project.

For customers who export chargeback statements on a monthly basis, the following recommendation applies:
chargeback statements of the previous month should be processed no earlier than one day after the
configured finalization date, at 7 a.m. (German local time). By default, chargeback statements are
finalized at the 6th of a month, therefore, they can be processed starting at the 7th of a month
at 7 a.m. If you are unsure about the configuration of the finalization day of chargebacks in your
meshStack, please contact our support team.

**Authentication:** This endpoint supports API User authentication.

parameters.name: workspaceIdentifier
parameters.description: Filter for meshChargebacks that belong to the meshWorkspace with given identifier. (optional)

parameters.name: projectIdentifier
parameters.description: Filter for meshChargebacks that belong to the meshProject with given identifier. (optional)

parameters.name: period
parameters.description: Filter for meshChargebacks that belong to the provided period, e.g. '2022-01-01Z' (optional)

parameters.name: finalized
parameters.description: Filter for finalized or preview meshChargebacks. Provide 'true' to get finalized meshChargebacks or provide 'false' to get preview meshChargebacks.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number (default=0). Information about [paging](/api/technical-specifications/#paging)

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The amount of elements in a single page (default=50). Information about [paging](/api/technical-specifications/#paging)

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: A custom order for sorting the results (optional). For meshChargebacks it is possible to filter by the following fields: `name`, `customerIdentifier`, `projectIdentifier`, `period`, `partnerIdentifier`. Possible directions are 'asc' or 'desc'. (e.g. sort=name,desc)

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: meshApi is versioned and you should use  `application/vnd.meshcloud.api.meshchargeback.v3.hal+json` as an `Accept` header to be guaranteed the V3 response format of this endpoint. New versions might be added in future.

get.description:
List all meshTenantUsageReports with optional filtering by workspace, project, and time period.

**Note**: If no request parameters for filtering are specified, all meshTenantUsageReports,
except for cancelled ones, are returned. A meshTenantUsageReport gets cancelled, if any changes
occur after finalization of it. A new meshTenantUsageReport with an incremented version gets
created in case of such an update. So the old one is available as cancelled, and the new as
finalized. By default, meshTenantUsageReports are sorted descending by period.

A meshTenantUsageReport contains all cost and payment information as well as tags for one tenant in
one period (month). Via the API, you receive more detailed information than via the UI. Besides tags
and payment information, you also get the seller information separated via line items
in the meshTenantUsageReport.

**Authentication:** This endpoint supports API User authentication.

parameters.name: ownedByWorkspace
parameters.description: Filter for meshTenantUsageReports that belong to the meshWorkspace with given identifier. (optional)

parameters.name: ownedByProject
parameters.description: Filter for meshTenantUsageReports that belong to the meshProject with given identifier. Make sure to also filter for ownedByWorkspace, as a project identifier is only unique inside a workspace! (optional)

parameters.name: isManaged
parameters.description: Filter for meshTenantUsageReports that are either managed or not managed by meshStack! meshStack collects all cost information from the cloud platform for all tenants. If a tenant is not managed by meshStack, it is an unmanaged tenant. If you provide `true` for this filter parameter, you only get meshTenantUsageReports for tenants that are managed by meshStack. If you provide `false`, you only get meshTenantUsageReports of unmanaged tenants. (optional)

parameters.name: platform
parameters.description: Filter for meshTenantUsageReports that belong to the provided platform in the format `<platformIdentifier>.<locationIdentifier>` (optional)

parameters.name: platformType
parameters.description: Filter for meshTenantUsageReports that belong to the provided platform type. Must be one of: `Azure`, `Aws`, `Gcp`, `AzureResourceGroup`, `AzureKubernetesService`, `Kubernetes`, `OpenShift`, `OpenStack`, `CloudFoundry`, `MeshMarketplace`, `GitHub`, `Custom` (optional)

parameters.name: platformTenantId
parameters.description: Filter for meshTenantUsageReports that belong to a certain tenant that can be identified via platform tenant ID (optional)

parameters.name: period
parameters.description: Filter for meshTenantUsageReports that belong to the provided period in format YYYY-MM, e.g. `2025-01` (optional)

parameters.name: reportCategory
parameters.description: Filter for meshTenantUsageReports that belong to the provided reportCategory, `BILLING` or `ENVIRONMENTAL`. (optional)

parameters.name: paymentMethodIdentifier
parameters.description: Filter for meshTenantUsageReports that have the meshPaymentMethod with given identifier assigned. Use an empty or blank value to filter for meshTenantUsageReports without an assigned meshPaymentMethod. (optional)

parameters.name: finalizedAfter
parameters.description: Filter for meshTenantUsageReports that were finalized after the provided date (e.g. `2025-06-01T00:00:00Z`). You can use this filter to retrieve all meshTenantUsageReports finalized after your last request for processing them in your billing system. You can e.g. provide the latest finalizationDate you received in your last request. You may then receive the newly finalized usage reports of the new period and probably updated usage reports of previous periods. This filter parameter is exclusive, meaning it will only match reports that were finalized after the given date. (optional)

parameters.name: cancelledAfter
parameters.description: Filter for meshTenantUsageReports that were cancelled after the provided date (e.g. 2025-06-01T00:00:00Z). When you apply this filter is provided, you will only get cancelled usage reports, meaning outdated data that was already updated. This filter parameter is exclusive, meaning it will only match reports that were cancelled after the given date. (optional)

parameters.name: showCancelled
parameters.description: By default, cancelled meshTenantUsageReports are not included in the response. If you want to include them, you can set this parameter to `true`. This is not required when you already filter for cancelledAfter. (optional)

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Filter for meshTenantUsageReports that are in the given state `OPEN`, `FINALIZED` or `UPDATED`. You can e.g. use this filter to exclude meshTenantUsageReports that have never been finalized yet (e.g. preview usage reports of the current month) or to get all usage reports that were UPDATED at least once. You can provide this parameter multiple times, e.g. to get only FINALIZED and UPDATED usage reports: `?status=FINALIZED&status=UPDATED`. (optional)

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number (default=0). Information about [paging](/api/technical-specifications/#paging)

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The amount of elements in a single page (default=50). Information about [paging](/api/technical-specifications/#paging)

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: A custom order for sorting the results (optional). For meshTenantUsageReports it is possible to filter by the following fields: `platform`, `platformType`, `platformTenantId`, `ownedByWorkspace`, `ownedByProject`, `total`, `generatedAt`, `reportCategory`, `paymentMethodIdentifier`, `finalizedAt`, `cancelledAt`. Possible directions are 'asc' or 'desc'. (e.g. sort=platform,desc)

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: meshApi is versioned and you should use  `application/vnd.meshcloud.api.meshtenantusagereport.v3.hal+json` as an `Accept` header to be guaranteed the V3 response format of this endpoint. New versions might be added in future.

get.description:
Retrieve detailed information about a specific meshTenantUsageReport including line items and payment details

**Authentication:** This endpoint supports API User authentication.

parameters.name: uuid
parameters.description: The UUID that uniquely identifies the meshTenantUsageReport.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: meshApi is versioned and you should use  `application/vnd.meshcloud.api.meshtenantusagereport.v3.hal+json` as an `Accept` header to be guaranteed the V3 response format of this endpoint. New versions might be added in future.

get.description:
Retrieve detailed information about a specific meshChargeback including line items and cost breakdown

**Authentication:** This endpoint supports API User authentication.

parameters.name: period
parameters.description: The period of the chargeback in YYYY-MM-DDZ format (e.g. '2025-02-01Z').

parameters.name: scopeId
parameters.description: The 'scope' consisting of partner identifier, workspace identifier and project identifier separated by ':' (e.g. 'testPartner:testWorkspace:testProject').

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: meshApi is versioned and you should use  `application/vnd.meshcloud.api.meshchargeback.v3.hal+json` as an `Accept` header to be guaranteed the V3 response format of this endpoint. New versions might be added in future.

put.description:
Use this endpoint to provide cost data from external systems to meshStack. A meshResourceUsageReport will be picked up by the billing system of meshStack and subsequently included into regular meshTenantUsageReports.

**Authentication:** This endpoint supports API User authentication.

parameters.name: platformTenantId
parameters.description: The Platform Tenant ID of the tenant causing the costs.

parameters.name: period
parameters.description: The month during which the costs have occurred, e.g. 2023-05-01Z for May 2023.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: meshObject Import is versioned and `application/vnd.meshcloud.api.meshobjects.v1+yaml` or `application/vnd.meshcloud.api.meshobjects.v1+json` can be used as a `Content-Type`.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: meshApi is versioned and you should use  `application/vnd.meshcloud.api.meshobjects.v1+json` as an `Accept` header to be guaranteed the V1 response format of this endpoint. New versions will be added in future.

meshResourceUsageReportPut.value:
{
    "apiVersion": "v1",
    "kind": "meshResourceUsageReport",
    "fullPlatformIdentifier": "my-platform-instance.my-location",
    "source": "Name of Source System",
    "lineItems": [
        {
            "productName": "Virtual Machine",
            "sellerId": "CloudHaven Inc.",
            "sellerProductGroup": "Compute",
            "usageQuantity": 48,
            "usageType": "Hours of CPU/RAM usage",
            "usageCost": 1.2,
            "currency": "USD",
            "usageUnit": "h",
            "totalCost": 57.6
        },
        {
            "productName": "SSD storage",
            "sellerId": "CloudHaven Inc.",
            "sellerProductGroup": "Storage",
            "usageQuantity": 480,
            "usageType": "Hours of usage multiplied by amounts of GB",
            "usageCost": 0.05,
            "currency": "USD",
            "usageUnit": "h",
            "totalCost": 24
        }
    ]
}

_links.description: All available meshObject Links for the authenticated user.
Currently only contains the self link and pagination links.

_embedded.description: Contains the actual content of the paged response.

_links.description: All available Top-Level Links for the authenticated user.

meshObject.description: The name of the meshObject (this is always set to meshResourceUsageReport)

resultCode.description:
Optional. Specific result code for this import result. If no error has occurred, it's set to null.
Otherwise, it's set to SERVER_ERROR, as this is is
the only possible error code at the moment.

message.description: Optional. A user readable message with more details. (might be null)

remarks.description: Optional. User readable remarks on this import result. (might be null)

status.description: The import result status for this meshResourceUsageReport. (SUCCESS or FAILED)

finalized.description: Finalization state of the meshChargeback. Value is 'true' for finalized and 'false' for preview meshChargebacks.

finalizationDate.description: The date when the meshChargeback was finalized. Can be null in case of preview meshChargebacks.

name.description: A name a meshChargeback can be uniquely identified with.

version.description: If an update to an already finalized meshChargeback comes in, the old meshChargeback gets cancelled and a new meshChargeback is created. The version is incremented in that case. For an initial or a preview meshChargeback, the version is 1.

cancellationDate.description: If an update to an already finalized meshChargeback comes in, the old meshChargeback gets cancelled. The cancellationDate provides the date at which this cancellation happened.

metadata.description: Contains attributes to identify a meshChargeback.

apiVersion.description: Version of meshChargeback datatype. Matches the version provided in the `Accept` request header.

kind.description: As a common meshObject structure exists, every meshObject has a 'kind'. This is always 'meshChargeback' for this endpoint.

period.description: The period of the meshChargeback, e.g. '2022-01-01Z'.

workspaceIdentifier.description: The meshWorkspace identifier this meshChargeback belongs to.

projectIdentifier.description: The meshProject identifier this meshChargeback belongs to.

tags.description: Key/Value pairs associated with this meshChargeback. This includes meshWorkspace, meshProject & meshPaymentMethod tags. Additionally metadata like paymentMethod attributes are provided. Keep in mind, that values are represented as an array to be consistent with other meshObjects. But at the moment, if multiple values are set for a certain tag, only the first value is available on a meshChargeback.

spec.description: All fields in this section describe the meshChargeback.

lineItems.description: List of all tenant usage reports that have been booked on a meshChargeback. One lineItem is created per Tenant Usage Report and currency.

period.description: Report Period in which the usage for this line item actually occurred. If for some reason a usage report was not finalized before the related chargeback period ended, it will be added to a later meshChargeback. So meshChargebacks can contain line items from different reporting periods.

sellerId.description: SellerId configured in meshStack for certain meshPlatforms or even specific products within a platform. This can be used to identify the department or group inside your company the netAmount will be charged to.

platformTenantId.description: Id of the actual platform tenant in the cloud platform (e.g. AWS Account Id or OpenShift Project Id).

baseNetAmount.description: The converted amount. For example, if currency is USD and baseCurrency is EUR, this will be the amount resulting from conversion from USD to EUR.

reportId.description: Id of the Tenant Usage Report this lineItem relates to.

netAmount.description: Total cost associated with the given Tenant Usage Report for one currency.

entryDate.description: Date when the usage report was actually finalized and not modified anymore afterwards.

reportCategory.description: Tenant Usage Reports can either belong to category BILLING or ENVIRONMENTAL. This separation is needed as this kind of different data is provided in quite different time intervals.

currency.description: Currency for the netAmount listed in this lineItem. Multiple lineItems are created if a Tenant Usage Report has costs distributed across multiple currencies.

sellerProductGroup.description: With the sellerProductGroup the seller information can be further refined. This is for example used to identify the different service brokers used in the meshMarketplace.

platformFullIdentifier.description: meshStack identifier of the platform the tenant belongs to.

baseCurrency.description: Currency for the baseNetAmount listed in this lineItem. This value is either null or EUR.

netAmounts.description: NetAmounts per currency are provided here.

amount.description: The actual cost associated with the given currency.

baseNetAmount.description: The converted amount. For example, if currency is USD and baseCurrency is EUR, this will be the amount resulting from conversion from USD to EUR.

baseCurrency.description: The currency the amount was converted to. This value is either null or EUR.

from.description: At which point in time the period started (usually beginning of month).

to.description: Before which point in time the period ended (usually beginning of next month).

timeframe.description: This provides actual details about the period the meshChargeback was generated for.

status.description: All fields in this section provide detailed content of the meshChargeback.

usageUnit.description: The unit of the given usageQuantity, for example, h for hours or d for days.

usageCost.description: The cost per consumed usageUnit. usageQuantity multiplied by usageCost should always equal totalCost.

sellerId.description: Optional. An identifier of the seller who provides the services and is the recipient of the payment. E.g. the name of a cloud provider, or for internal costs the name of a department.

currency.description: The ISO-4217 compliant currency code, e.g. EUR or USD.

usageQuantity.description: The usage quantity, for example, 48 if a product was used for 48 hours.

sellerProductGroup.description: Optional. A sub-category of the seller if more fine-grained assignment is needed. E.g. different payment methods the seller has for the services it provides in a platform.

totalCost.description: totalCost equals usageQuantity multiplied by usageCost.

usageType.description: To elaborate on the usageUnit, this field is used to describe what exactly is consumed and billed, for example, 'hours of CPU/RAM usage'.

apiVersion.description: Required for backwards compatibility. v1 is the only supported version at the moment.

fullPlatformIdentifier.description: An identifier in the format $platformInstance.$location, where $platformInstance refers to the identifier of the meshPlatform, and $location refers to the identifier of the meshLocation.

source.description: Name of the system where this ResourceUsageReport originates from.

_links.description: Currently only contains the self link and pagination links.

_embedded.description: Contains the actual content of the paged response.

ownedByProject.description: The identifier of the project the meshTenantUsageReport belongs to or null if the tenant is not managed by meshStack. (optional)

createdAt.description: The date the meshTenantUsageReport was created in the system that serves the API.

uuid.description: A uuid that identifies a meshTenantUsageReport uniquely.

ownedByWorkspace.description: The identifier of the workspace the meshTenantUsageReport belongs to or null if the tenant is not managed by meshStack. (optional)

metadata.description: Contains common attributes of a meshTenantUsageReport, that also exist on other meshObjects.

apiVersion.description: Version of meshTenantUsageReport datatype. Matches the version provided in the `Accept` request header.

_links.description: meshTenantUsageReports currently only provide a self link.

kind.description: As a common meshObject structure exists, every meshObject has a 'kind'. This is always 'meshTenantUsageReport' for this endpoint.

period.description: The period of the meshTenantUsageReport, e.g. `2025-01`.

platformTenantId.description: The platformTenantId that the meshTenantUsageReport belongs to.

platformType.description: The platformType of the platform the meshTenantUsageReport belongs to. One of: `Azure`, `Aws`, `Gcp`, `AzureResourceGroup`, `AzureKubernetesService`, `Kubernetes`, `OpenShift`, `OpenStack`, `CloudFoundry`, `MeshMarketplace`, `GitHub`, `Custom`

reportCategory.description: The reportCategory of the meshTenantUsageReport, possible options are `BILLING` or `ENVIRONMENTAL`.

version.description: When a TenantUsageReport is updated after it was already finalized, the version is always increased by 1.

platform.description: The platformFullIdentifier of the platform the meshTenantUsageReport belongs to.

spec.description: All fields in this section describe the meshTenantUsageReport.

lineItems.description: Top-Level line items of the TenantUsageReport. Separate line items are created by sellerId, sellerProductGroup and currency.

sellerId.description: Seller information can be provided in the Product Catalog of meshStack. You can e.g. use the sellerId to separate costs coming from the cloud platform and additional fees that are applied by your company's platform team.

amount.description: The concrete amount of reported costs in the original currency.

exchangeRate.description: The actual exchange rate that was used for conversion to the base currency.

currency.description: The currency used for the corresponding amount.

baseCurrency.description: Currency for the baseAmount. This value is either null or EUR.

baseAmount.description: The converted amount. For example, if currency is USD and baseCurrency is EUR, this will be the amount resulting from conversion from USD to EUR.

netAmount.description: A list of total reported amounts separated by currency.

sellerProductGroup.description: The sellerProductGroup can specify the seller information to a more detailed level. It is for example used to provide the service broker name in case of a meshMarketplace usage report. The sellerId is set to the workspace identifier in that case.

from.description: At which point in time the period started (usually beginning of month).

to.description: Before which point in time the period ended (usually beginning of next month).

timeframe.description: This provides details about the period the meshTenantUsageReport was generated for.

finalizedAt.description: Date when the meshTenantUsageReport was finalized.

cancelledAt.description: Date when the meshTenantUsageReport was cancelled and replaced by a new meshTenantUsageReport.

generatedAt.description: Date when the meshTenantUsageReport was generated initially.

identifier.description: The identifier of the related payment method.

amount.description: The amount of the related payment method, if set. (optional)

name.description: The name of the related payment method.

expirationDate.description: The expiration date of the related payment method, if set. (optional)

paymentMethod.description: The payment method that was assigned to the project the related tenant belongs to in the given period.

tags.description: The related tags, that were inherited for the given period to the related tenant. This includes `workspace`, `project` and `payment method` tags. The values are provided as an array,as multiple values can be set for some tags.

status.description: All fields in this section provide detailed content of the meshTenantUsageReport.
